sources.snippet_or_excerpt: Bears have a firm grip on the leading GameFi tokens, with the majority of them in the red.
A hoped-for breakout year in 2025 failed to materialize as the October crypto crash dragged down the already struggling corner of the alts...

Bitcoin's oversold RSI signals a potential rally to $170K, analysts argue, as record ETF inflows and fading headwinds build a bullish case.
BitFuFu Inc. is deeply undervalued versus peers, trading at a forward EV/Sales of 1.23x. Click here to read why FUFU stock is a Buy.

hypothesis_content.title: Failed Breakdown as Bullish Reversal Signal
hypothesis_content.statement: In a NEUTRAL or BULL regime, if BTC price breaks below a key recent support level (e.g., -3% from current price) on low volume (<80% of 20-day average) and then reclaims that level within 12 hours, it will trigger a strong mean-reversion bounce back towards the range high.
hypothesis_content.rationale: A low-volume breakdown suggests a lack of committed selling. A swift reclaim of the level indicates the breakdown was a 'false move' or liquidity grab, trapping weak shorts. In a non-bearish regime, this often leads to a sharp reversal as trapped positions are covered.
entry_conditions: BTC 1-hour candle closes >3% below the prior session's low (defining the breakdown).
Volume on breakdown candle is <80% of 20-period average volume.
Price then rallies to close back above the breakdown level within the next 12 hourly candles.

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price rallies to test the most recent local high prior to the breakdown.
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price makes a new low below the initial breakdown close.
exit_conditions.time_exit: 36 hours after the re-entry signal (close back above support).

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Price reclaims the breakdown level but immediately fails again, showing no bullish momentum and confirming the initial break as valid, leading to continued downward movement.
